meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characterized by argument or controversy.
meanings.sent1: Her eristic behavior always led to heated debates.
meanings.sent2: The eristic nature of the discussion made it difficult to reach a consensus.
meanings.sent3: The eristic cat insisted on arguing with its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: His eristic attitude turned every conversation into a battleground of words.
meanings.sent5: The eristic clouds in the sky seemed to be arguing over who would bring the rain.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in controversial argument; a controversialist.
meanings.sent1: She was known as an eristic in the academic circles for her love of debates.
meanings.sent2: The eristic at the party always managed to stir up interesting discussions.
meanings.sent3: The eristic comedian had the audience laughing at his witty arguments.
meanings.sent4: He was an eristic in the courtroom, always challenging the opposing counsel.
meanings.sent5: The eristic in the group never shied away from a good argument.
